acadPlanDescription.description: Brief description/title of this academic plan, sourced from best of 3 different data fields, in order of preference

acadPlanMarketingDescription.description: Same as acadPlanDescription except with a different order of data field preference

acadPlanTranscriptDescription.description: Brief description/title used for the transcript. Not populated for all plans.

fullDescription.description: Explanation (multiple sentences; paragraph format) of this academic plan. Contains HTML formatting.

emailAddrOnline.description: Alternate contact email address for plan for ASU Online purposes

languageRequired.description: Indicates if second language coursework is required to complete this plan

mathIntensityCode.description: Math Intensity Category (eg. General, Moderate, Substantial) - represents a measure of the number and academic rigor of math courses required for this plan

mathRequired.description: Math is required to complete this plan

firstMathCourseRequired.courseId.description: First required math course - course ID

firstMathCourseRequired.catalogNumber.description: First required math course - catalog number

firstMathCourseRequiredSupplementalText.description: First required math course - supplemental text (includes HTML formatting)

additionalFee.description: This plan has an additional fee

careerOpportunities.description: Career opportunity information. Contains HTML formatting.

professionalLicensureStandardText.description: Professional licensure standard text (includes HTML formatting. Warning: malformed HTML)

professionalLicensureAdditionalText.description: Professional licensure additional text (includes HTML formatting)

marketingText.description: Supplemental marketing blurb / sales pitch - used to manipulate SEO. (Includes HTML formatting)

globalExperienceText.description: Supplemental text for global perspective of plan (Includes HTML formatting)

globalDegreeText.description: Supplemental text for global degree applicability of plan (Includes HTML formatting)

transferAdmissionRequirementsText.description: Transfer admission requirements text (Includes HTML formatting)

activeInDegreeSearch.description: Indicates if this plan should be displayed in degree search

applicantsMustChooseSecondMajor.description: Indicates if an applicant needs to select a second major (this major has higher-level requirements)

campusesOffered.description: List of campuses where this plan is offered for instruction

degreeDescriptionLong.description: Long degree description (eg. Bachelor of Science)

degreeDescriptionText.description: Text information describing the degree (eg. An undergraduate degree that advances the understanding of...)

degreeEducationLevel.description: Education level code associated with this degree.

planKeywords.description: Set of search keywords for this plan

videoUrl.description: URL of marketing video for plan

customText.description: Supplemental optional text that displays in degree search near the top; typically used to note plans that are active but no longer accepting applications or new students. Note: sometimes contains (occasionally malformed) HTML

degreeRequirements.description: Text describing degree requirements for graduate degrees. Note: includes HTML formatting

minorCourseRequirements.description: Text describing course requirements for minors. Warn: includes HTML formatting w/ css classes.

graduateDegreeAdditionalRequirements.description: Set of degree requirements for grad plans from academic advising requirement tables.

owners.description: List of department owner(s) for plan

degreeType.description: Categorization of plan by degree type: UG = Undergraduate degrees UGCM = Non-graduate/non-law certificates (incl. standalone certificates) and minors GR = Graduate and Law OTHR = Other; plans that don't meet criteria for above

applicationDeadlines.description: Application deadlines for the plan, per campus/session/term/admitType

additionalDeadlines.description: Additional/alternate application deadline data for some GRAD plans - shows in degree search under headline of Application Deadlines For GRAD only (but not all GRAD)
